section.title: Present Continuous
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Continuous to talk about (a) actions happening at the time of speaking and (b) temporary actions happening around now, but perhaps not at this moment.
section.text2a: He's doing a lot of exercise at the moment.
section.sectiontitle2: To make the Present Continuous, use the subject + verb to be + -ing.
section.text3a: I'm checking my emails at the moment.
section.text4: She has a lie-in on Saturdays.
section.text4a: She's having a lie-in today.

section.title: Present Continuous
section.sectiontitle: To make the negative, use 'm not, aren't (or 're not) and isn't (or 's not).
section.text1a: We're not going to the cinema or We aren't going to the cinema.
section.text2a: She's not going to be late or She isn't going to bed late.
section.sectiontitle2: To make questions in the Present Continuous, use am/are/is + subject + -ing. For short answers use the verb to be.
section.text3a: A: Are you having a lie-in? B: Yes, I am.
section.text4a: A: Is she having a lie-in? B: No, she's not.

section.title: Present Continuous
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Simple (NOT the Present Continuous) with state verbs. Examples of state verbs are: like, love, hate, want, need, prefer, know, understand, believe, remember.
section.text1a: I know how to play chess.
section.text2a: I like watching sport on TV.
